We're working on more stories right now

            By 
Alex Isenstadt

08/31/15, 12:43 PM EDT
Rick Perry, floundering in polls and fundraising, is cutting his Iowa operation as he prepares to refocus his long-shot campaign on South Carolina.
Perry’s advisers said on Monday that they would be trimming their Iowa team to just one paid staffer, strategist Jamie Johnson. Others, it said, would be let go.
“We talked to all the staff,” said Bob Haus, Perry’s top strategist in the state. Haus said he would still work for the former Texas governor, but on an unpaid basis.
The decision was widely anticipated, with Perry’s advisers informing Iowa staff last week that a cut-back was on the immediate horizon. In the days prior, some of Perry’s staff had been working on an unpaid basis for a period of time.
“I think it’s based financial reasons,” said Haus, adding that the former governor did not wish to see staff go unpaid. 
One top Perry adviser, Karen Fesler, submitted her letter of resignation on Monday and said that she would be joining Rick Santorum's campaign. Fesler, an influential activist in the state, also worked for Santorum in 2012.

Alex Isenstadt is a reporter for Politico.

                                            By 
Nahal Toosi


                                            By 
Sam Nunn
                                             and

title: Perry cuts Iowa team to one paid staffer
